name: Basic Technical Inspection
description: Basic technical inspection checklist for non-Everdrone personnel to perform simple onsite inspection and maintenance tasks

tasks.title: BATTERY: Remove old batteries
tasks.description:
Safely remove and dispose of old batteries from the drone.

Power down the drone completely.
Carefully disconnect battery connectors.
Remove batteries from mounting points.
Store old batteries safely for disposal.

tasks.title: BATTERY: Install new batteries
tasks.description:
Mount fresh batteries and ensure proper connection.

Verify new batteries are correct type.
Securely mount batteries in compartment.
Connect battery cables properly.
Secure with retention straps.

tasks.title: BATTERY: Verify battery charge
tasks.description:
Confirm new batteries are fully charged and properly seated.

Check battery charge indicators.
Verify secure mounting.
Confirm proper cable connections.
Test power delivery.

tasks.title: MEDICAL: Remove old medical kit
tasks.description:
Safely remove the expired medical kit from the drone.

Locate medical kit compartment.
Release mounting mechanisms.
Carefully remove old kit.
Document removal for records.

tasks.title: MEDICAL: Mount new medical kit
tasks.description:
Install new medical kit and verify secure attachment.

Check new kit expiration date.
Place kit in mounting position.
Secure all retention mechanisms.
Verify kit cannot move during flight.
instructions: Verify medical kit is within date

tasks.title: MEDICAL: Verify kit expiration date
tasks.description:
Confirm new medical kit is within valid date range.

Check expiration date on kit.
Record installation date.
Verify contents list is present.
Confirm kit seal is intact.

tasks.title: STRUCTURE: Check for cracks or gaps
tasks.description:
Are there any cracks in the fuselage or gaps in the joints around the foldable arms?

Inspect main body for cracks.
Check all arm joints thoroughly.
Examine folding mechanisms.
Look for separation in seams.

tasks.title: PROPELLER: Test propeller rotation
tasks.description:
Do unusual sounds occur when spinning propellers with fingers? Crackling sounds may indicate dirt in motor bearings and should not be ignored.

Spin each propeller by hand.
Listen for unusual sounds.
Feel for resistance or grinding.
Note any irregularities.
instructions: Rotate each propeller slowly by hand
Listen carefully for crackling or grinding

tasks.title: HARDWARE: Check screws and fasteners
tasks.description:
Are any screws, fasteners, joints or attachments loose or damaged? Replace if necessary.

Check all visible screws.
Test joint tightness.
Inspect fastener condition.
Tighten or replace as needed.

tasks.title: PROPELLER: Inspect propellers
tasks.description:
Are there any damages or cracks on the propellers? Never fly with damaged propellers.

Visually inspect each blade.
Check for chips or cracks.
Verify blade straightness.
Replace if any damage found.
instructions: Look for chips, cracks, or deformation

tasks.title: ELECTRICAL: Check cables
tasks.description:
Are there any loose or damaged cables?

Inspect all visible wiring.
Check cable connections.
Look for fraying or cuts.
Ensure proper cable routing.

tasks.title: ELECTRICAL: Check connections
tasks.description:
Are there any loose or damaged connections?

Inspect all connectors.
Verify secure attachment.
Check for corrosion.
Ensure proper seating.

tasks.title: PROPELLER: Verify propeller attachments
tasks.description:
Are propeller mounts, screws and propeller locks secure? (Check that they are tightened)

Test propeller mounting security.
Verify locking mechanisms engaged.
Check mounting screws tightness.
Confirm no play in attachments.
instructions: Ensure no movement when pulled gently
